info.title: Christmas Trivia Quiz
info.description: Test your knowledge about Christmas traditions, history, and pop culture! Each question will challenge your festive knowledge. Good luck!

questions.question: In which modern-day country was Saint Nicholas born?
questions.justification: Saint Nicholas was born in Patara, a city in ancient Lycia, in what is now modern-day Turkey.

questions.question: Which company was the first to use Santa Claus in advertising?
questions.justification: While Coca-Cola didn't create Santa Claus, they were the first to use the modern image of Santa in their advertisements starting in 1931.

questions.question: What was the first artificial Christmas tree made from?
questions.justification: The first artificial Christmas trees were developed in Germany in the 19th century and were made using dyed goose feathers.

questions.question: In which year was 'Silent Night' first performed?
questions.justification: Silent Night (Stille Nacht) was first performed on Christmas Eve 1818 in Oberndorf, Austria.

questions.question: What is the best-selling Christmas song of all time?
choices: All I Want for Christmas Is You
questions.justification: Bing Crosby's 'White Christmas' is the best-selling Christmas song, with over 50 million copies sold worldwide.

questions.question: Which country started the tradition of putting up Christmas trees?
questions.justification: The Christmas tree tradition began in 16th century Germany, when devout Christians brought decorated trees into their homes.

questions.question: What is 'Boxing Day'?
choices: The day to box up decorations
A day to give boxes of gifts to the poor
questions.answer: A day to give boxes of gifts to the poor
questions.justification: Boxing Day traditionally was when servants and workers would receive Christmas boxes from their employers.

questions.question: Which of Santa's reindeer is named after weather phenomenon?
questions.justification: Donner and Blitzen mean 'thunder and lightning' in German.

questions.question: What Christmas decoration was originally made from strands of silver?
questions.justification: Tinsel was originally made from real silver strands and was created in Germany in the early 1600s.

questions.question: What is traditionally hidden inside a Christmas pudding?
questions.justification: Traditionally, several small trinkets were hidden in the pudding, each with a special meaning for the finder.

questions.question: Which country is credited with creating the Advent calendar?
questions.justification: The first printed Advent calendar was created by Gerhard Lang in Germany in the early 1900s.

questions.question: What is Frankincense?
questions.justification: Frankincense is an aromatic resin used for incense and perfumes, and was one of the gifts brought to baby Jesus.

questions.question: When was Christmas first celebrated on December 25th?
questions.justification: The first recorded Christmas celebration on December 25th was in Rome in 336 AD.

questions.question: Which country has a tradition of eating KFC for Christmas dinner?
questions.justification: Since 1974, eating KFC for Christmas has become a popular tradition in Japan, thanks to a successful marketing campaign.

questions.question: What was the original color of Santa's suit?
questions.justification: Before the red suit became standard, Santa was often depicted wearing green, which represented the coming spring.
